title: Barclays to close expats' bank accounts - unless they deposit £100,000
text:
280.10 +0.100 
Expats in certain countries will need £100,000 in their accounts to avoid being sacked by their bank 
Expats in certain countries who bank with Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) are being told to take their business elsewhere. 
The bank said it will shut down accounts that are worth less than £100,000 in the next couple of months. 
Some letters to expats in Cyprus have already been issued to those who are affected and state: “We understand that you may be disappointed by this and we will aim to offer you as much assistance as possible during this transition period.” 
A spokesman for the bank said more letters will be issued in due course to expats who reside in a country that Barclays is no longer focusing on. 
The spokesman added that the bank has previously announced, in 2013, that it would focus on 70 countries globally. 
Customers in those that are not considered “core”, such as Cyprus, will have their accounts closed unless they have more than £100,000. 
It is understood this minimum threshold will also apply to expats who reside in Greece and Malta. 
Barclays refused to be drawn on how many expats will see their bank accounts close.
